trans-unit.source: User's Manual - Content Level A/B Testing
trans-unit.target: User's Manual - Content Level A/B Testing

trans-unit.source: Prerequisite:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisite:

trans-unit.source: Please follow the step [How to Join the Microsoft GitHub Organization](http://https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service) to link your GitHub account with Microsoft organization.
trans-unit.target: Please follow the step [How to Join the Microsoft GitHub Organization](http://https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service) to link your GitHub account with Microsoft organization.

trans-unit.source: Read the CSI instruction to understand the process how to `CREATE` / `EDIT` / `COMMIT` Markdown file to GitHub.
trans-unit.target: Read the CSI instruction to understand the process how to `CREATE` / `EDIT` / `COMMIT` Markdown file to GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Use working branch before merge into Live environment which is always a **BEST PRACTISE**.
trans-unit.target: Use working branch before merge into Live environment which is always a **BEST PRACTISE**.

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step:
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step:

trans-unit.source: Create a new experiment - Part I: Set up the experimental files.
trans-unit.target: Create a new experiment - Part I: Set up the experimental files.

trans-unit.source: The A/B test requires two separate markdown files, the A variant, and the B variant.
trans-unit.target: The A/B test requires two separate markdown files, the A variant, and the B variant.

trans-unit.source: You may already have an A variant as an existing published page.
trans-unit.target: You may already have an A variant as an existing published page.

trans-unit.source: Switch to your Stage branch.
trans-unit.target: Switch to your Stage branch.

trans-unit.source: If you are working locally, switch to your local staging branch.
trans-unit.target: If you are working locally, switch to your local staging branch.

trans-unit.source: The staging branch is whichever branch you use to commit changes that will be published to [stage endpoint](https://stage.docs.microsoft.com).
trans-unit.target: The staging branch is whichever branch you use to commit changes that will be published to [stage endpoint](https://stage.docs.microsoft.com).

trans-unit.source: Edit Variant A Page:
trans-unit.target: Edit Variant A Page:

trans-unit.source: Edit your source file (Page A) by adding the following metadata::
trans-unit.target: Edit your source file (Page A) by adding the following metadata::

trans-unit.source: experiment_id is the unique id for your experiment.
trans-unit.target: experiment_id is the unique id for your experiment.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that your experiment id be of the form <youralias>-<experimentname>-<date
trans-unit.target: We recommend that your experiment id be of the form <youralias>-<experimentname>-<date

trans-unit.source: Create Variant B Page:
trans-unit.target: Create Variant B Page:

trans-unit.source: Create a Variant B page for the topic in the same folder using all of Page A’s original metadata.
trans-unit.target: Create a Variant B page for the topic in the same folder using all of Page A’s original metadata.

trans-unit.source: Add the experiment_id field and use the same experiment ID you created for the A variant.
trans-unit.target: Add the experiment_id field and use the same experiment ID you created for the A variant.

trans-unit.source: Use the following file name structure when you save the Variant B page: <sourcefilename>.experimental.md.
trans-unit.target: Use the following file name structure when you save the Variant B page: <sourcefilename>.experimental.md.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: If Variant A is CSI-demo.md, then Variant B should be CSI-demo.experimental.md
trans-unit.target: If Variant A is CSI-demo.md, then Variant B should be CSI-demo.experimental.md

trans-unit.source: Add and commit your changes.
trans-unit.target: Add and commit your changes.

trans-unit.source: If you are working locally, you will have to merge these local changes with the staging branch on GitHub with a pull request.
trans-unit.target: If you are working locally, you will have to merge these local changes with the staging branch on GitHub with a pull request.

trans-unit.source: If you are working on GitHub, simply commit the changes.
trans-unit.target: If you are working on GitHub, simply commit the changes.

trans-unit.source: Once the files are committed to the staging branch on GitHub, it will automatically trigger the OP build for the staging branch.
trans-unit.target: Once the files are committed to the staging branch on GitHub, it will automatically trigger the OP build for the staging branch.

trans-unit.source: Preview the result from portal
trans-unit.target: Preview the result from portal

trans-unit.source: Open OP Portal, wait until the build is completed without error message
trans-unit.target: Open OP Portal, wait until the build is completed without error message

trans-unit.source: Open stage site and preview the result
trans-unit.target: Open stage site and preview the result
